In the late nineteenth century, a young woman named Sarah and her husband, John, are forced to leave their home in Ireland for America after being accused of witchcraft by local villagers. They start anew life on a farm where they must learn to cope with the harsh realities of frontier life while caring for three children and avoiding threats from Native Americans who seek to drive them out. Based on true events that occurred during the Great Irish Famine and subsequent emigration to America, this drama explores the resilience and ingenuity of one family adapting to the challenges of pioneering a new life nthe American West.<step
